titleStmt.title: Samuel Marksbury et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6729

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excellency Thomas E. Bramlette Governor of Kentucky
The Petition of the Subscribers Citizens of Washington County Ky respectfully showeth

That one Preston Prather a Citizen of Washington County Stands charged in inditement before The Washington Circuit Court for the offence of Murder ^or wounding to death^ Committed when the person of one Thomas Colter on or about 25th day of June 1864 Of which offence the following is a True Statement as understood in this community -- Thomas Colter from the Commencement of the Rebellion had been a violent Secessionist -- Joined John Morgan's Command in the Rebel army in the fall of 1862 -- and returned to his home in Washington County Ky -- in the winter of 18634. Before Joining the Rebel army he busied himself -- in paroling Union Soldiers who he found at their homes on Furlough -- or passing unguarded through the country -- That after his return from the Rebel army -- he violated his parole of going about the Country heavily armed and threatening the persons ^lives^ of good Union Citizens -- That in the 12th day of May 1864 he in ^company with his son Levi Colter^ shot and Killed William Prather -- On the Eighteenth day of June 1864 he way laid and killed Henry H, Prather Boath good Union Men -- The -- Brothers of Preston Prather -- That same months before the Killing of William and Henry Prather, he in company with The nortorious Guerilla and out law, Isaah Colter visited the house of Thomas W, Prather father of aforesaid William & Henry Prather and shot at him with the intention of killing him. That Preston Prather is a good and
Peacable Citizen and law abiding man -- He is poor and unabled to bear the expense of a protracted and tedious trial to establish his guilt or innocence we would therefore respectfully and earnestly pray that he be pardoned of the offence charged against him
And your petitioners will ever pray &c

Samuel marksbury
George. W. Lambert
John Smith Capt Ky Cal
L. E. Noel
Wm. T. Ferrill
Mayfiel Hays
Preston C Ruherson
Phaschel Colvin

This day personally appeard before me Samuel Harris and made oath that this petition to which my nane is assignd in be half of Preston Prather is correct to the best of his Knowledge

Wm Edwards J. P. W. C
This July 18th 1865

this Day personal appeard James Sallen Samuel Marxbury Thomas Scott Willliam Brown William Hickerson Logan Hickerson Allen Turner and made oath that they are personal acquainted with Preston Prather & Thomas Colter as set forth in the petition and further surtifies to the truth of the Same to the best of ther Nollege
given under my hand this July 16 20th 1865Sworn to before me

James Ferrell J P W C
